title: Basic Fields
paragraph:
Each island have their own types of fields. The type of fields determine which units can be found and recruited there. All fields except special fields (e.g. {{ portals # article/fields/portal }}, {{ artifacts # article/fields/artifact }},...) are called basic fields. They all have a local skill tree to individualize each field. All basic fields are able to produce {{ soulstones # article/currencies/soulstones }}, but are limited in unit recruitment. A unit can only be recruited on certain fields (with the exception of {{  Spotter Nakis # article/units/spotter-naki }}). 
 Note that different rules apply to the world type Evolution!

dynamicContents.content: Grassland is a common field in the {{ starter island # article/islands/starter-island}}. Like forest, it's found on the outer rim of the starter island.
{{ Druid Nakis # article/units/druid-naki }} and {{ Grass Spirits # article/units/grass-spirit }} can be found on unclaimed grasslands. Both of the two units can be recruited there.
Forest is the counterpart to the grassland and can be found on the outer rim of starter islands too.
In the forest there are Druid Nakis too, but instead of the Grass Spirits, there are {{ Forest Spirits # article/units/forest-spirit }} which can be found and recruited there.
High grass is the third type of basic fields on the starter islands. It's located around the portal
High grass gives access to the powerful {{ Guard Nakis # article/units/guard-naki }}. But as valuable as the field is, it's harder to conquer than the grasslands and forest.
The portal around the {{ magic marsh # article/islands/magic-marsh }} is surrounded by the magic forest.
The magic marsh is the home of the {{ elder spirits # article/unit/elder-spirit }}. The elder spirit is the only unit recruitable in the magic forest (besides Spotter Nakis).
The swamp is outside of the magic forest in the magic marsh islands.
